text:
<@U4RP6AGV9> 
Do you add *<style>* in HTML + HUBL section to use those variables ? 

But doing this your <style> will appear in the section and not in the header :disappointed: Do you find a way to do this ?
this didn't work for me. I just need a classic related posts under each blog post ... grab the topics/tags of this post and give me x other posts that have the same tags :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi everyone! We would like to implement a Social Wall on our website, fetching all the post of Facebook published via HubSpot. Is it possible via Hubl?

Hi people, I created a .html file as a page and I noticed that in the         {{ standard_header_includes }} is not included the layout.css (which is the responsiveness css for the modules). Do I have to include it separate ? and where can I find that css file?

Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Only if you are using the default HubSpot grid.
I am using the default HS Grid
